intro: Wigandia kraussii, commonly known as the yellow false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Wigandia kraussii is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
